I wouldn't exactly call this an izakaya - there aren't exactly a lot of small dishes to order. It's more of a traditional Japanese restaurant with an extensive bar, including a lot of sake choices. That being said, it was actually some of the best...

Came here with a few friends for dinner.
Pros: Food was pretty good. They let you sit around and chat for a long time. Service was quick and on point. Restaurant has a good range of food to pick from.

This place near finch station serves pretty good Japanese eats with some daily specials which we took advantage of. We wanted sushi but they had recently revamped their menu so there weren't so much rolls as appetizers and pressed sushi. We shared a ebimayo $2...

Been a few times and it is a great location, close to the subway.
Very fresh food - sashimi, oysters (when available), fried squid and rolls.
Not cheap. Laid back with good service.
